TopicTitle: [Old] Dark Days - Dying of the light. - Kopernicus mod. (Continuation in works)

Articles.Content:
I had a lucid dream about this mod. There were like supply boxes and stuff, and Perseus and Hades and Kerbol were finished. I launched a spaceship and HyperEdited me into Trinthia orbit. There was this big blue asteroid that resembled stock Minmus.

The ship exploded and I woke up XD

But seriously here's a shot of an in-dev Trinthia.

Edited October 3, 2015 by ibuckshot5

I had a lucid dream about this mod. There were like supply boxes and stuff, and Perseus and Hades and Kerbol were finished. I launched a spaceship and HyperEdited me into Trinthia orbit. There was this big blue asteroid that resembled stock Minmus.

The ship exploded and I woke up XD

Well, in that case this mod literally blew your mind

- - - Updated - - -

Is there someway I can help with developing the pack? I'm good at making textures (both planets and clouds) and Environmental Visual Enhancements configs.

Well, in that case this mod literally blew your mind

- - - Updated - - -

Is there someway I can help with developing the pack? I'm good at making textures (both planets and clouds) and Environmental Visual Enhancements configs.

Sure. You can make cloud packs.

That is if you can show me a good example

Edited October 3, 2015 by daniel l.
Also, Trithia is in dire need of a new texture. I wanted to keep the "supercontinents seperated by a giant river" idea. I'm bad at textures and I need a little bit of help.

Also, Trithia is in dire need of a new texture. I wanted to keep the "supercontinents seperated by a giant river" idea. I'm bad at textures and I need a little bit of help.

Hmm. I found this little tutorial

Ok i have something to announce. Tadaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Development will start when this one is done.

Edited October 4, 2015 by daniel l.
Considering that i am soon to be making a new version of this mod (As mentioned above), Do you guys think i should open a website for this mod to reduce clutter on the ksp forums?

Sure. You can make cloud packs.

That is if you can show me a good example

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/134547-1-0-4-Arkas-%280-1%29-A-Thick-Atmosphere-on-a-Desert-World-17-Unique-Biomes-Custom-Science-Defs

Check the comments, there should be a few Imgur albums showing my work.

Check the comments, there should be a few Imgur albums showing my work.

And my Imgur images:

http://imgur.com/user/TheWhiteGuardian/submitted

I just saw them. HELL YEAH yes you may join!

Is there anything I can do to help? I'm mildly experienced at making planets, although I usually just import from spaceengine, that way they look more natural and cooler

i can also model/balance parts, but I suck at texturing

- - - Updated - - -

also, instead of making hordes of tiny tiny moonlets (which can cause lag), have you considered simply editing the system to make randomly generated large asteroids in regions with moonlets?

Is there anything I can do to help? I'm mildly experienced at making planets, although I usually just import from spaceengine, that way they look more natural and cooler

i can also model/balance parts, but I suck at texturing

- - - Updated - - -

also, instead of making hordes of tiny tiny moonlets (which can cause lag), have you considered simply editing the system to make randomly generated large asteroids in regions with moonlets?

Sure. You can do some modeling jobs for us. we need lots of b9 and lackluster style starship hulls. please make those

Also, Trithia is in dire need of a new texture. I wanted to keep the "supercontinents seperated by a giant river" idea. I'm bad at textures and I need a little bit of help.
Hmm. I found this little tutorial

please no...firstly that "guide" doesn't introduce polar coords into the texture which will result in really bad import into ksp as the poles will be warped beyond recognition. Secondly you don't need to use a texture at all. you can create perfect terrestrial planets in game using only LandControl. My recommendation will be to dig through the PQSMods and learn how it works.

Perhaps some inspiration for a "stock-alike" feel for your planets is in order

please no...firstly that "guide" doesn't introduce polar coords into the texture which will result in really bad import into ksp as the poles will be warped beyond recognition. Secondly you don't need to use a texture at all. you can create perfect terrestrial planets in game using only LandControl. My recommendation will be to dig through the PQSMods and learn how it works.

Perhaps some inspiration for a "stock-alike" feel for your planets is in order

Nice pic i see what you mean. I had a design style intended but really anything will do, so if ibuckshot reads this... please just use a space engine export or something.
No, I'll do it by proc gen. Much more effective
Hey Daniel, I found a good curve editor [thread=124708]here.[/thread]

Hey Daniel, I found a good curve editor [thread=124708]here.[/thread]

Cool. Pardon me but what am i supposed to do with it?
You wanted to do a stock revamp. Parts use curves, so I guess it will come in handy. Just look at the configs for parts.
Sorry for the lack of updates lately. Been kinda troubled. But it will resume soon. (Ibuckshot5 i dont mean to rush you but i could use those planets for finalizing.)
Are you planning any other crazy astronomical features?

Perhaps some inspiration for a "stock-alike" feel for your planets is in order

Oh my...

Just... how?

Are you planning any other crazy astronomical features?

I dont believe so.... Maybe i will see if there is anything extra i can do once the base pack is done.
Considering that i am not just working on this one mod. I am also making several behind the scenes, I dont want to clutter the ksp forums. should i make a website to host my projects?

Considering that i am not just working on this one mod. I am also making several behind the scenes, I dont want to clutter the ksp forums. should i make a website to host my projects?

If you know how to make a website, then it might be a good idea. However, I'd prefer the KSP forums, it helps keeping the plugins for KSP on one website and not scattered across the internet.
website is up! anyone who is interested in Dark Days and the other projects listed on the page should please consider joining its forum.

I like the idea of Eternal Black, I could try and have a go at helping with that mod, not very good at making planets so I will try to use that tutorial, can you PM me with some info (like the style and all that) of Eternal Black? Thanks.
